SEARCH
Package Core.Entities

Class Entity

java.lang.Object
Core.Entities.Entity
public class Entity extends Object
The Entity class represents an object in a 3D space with a model, position, rotation, and scale.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity(Model model, org.joml.Vector3f pos, org.joml.Vector3f rotation, float scale)
      Constructs a new Entity with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      model - The model associated with the entity.
      pos - The initial position of the entity represented by a Vector3f.
      rotation - The initial rotation of the entity represented by a Vector3f.
      scale - The scale factor of the entity.

  • Method Details

    • inc_pos

      public void inc_pos(float x, float y, float z)
      Increments the position of the entity by the specified amounts along the x, y, and z axes.
      Parameters:
      x - The amount to increment along the x-axis.
      y - The amount to increment along the y-axis.
      z - The amount to increment along the z-axis.

    • setPos

      public void setPos(float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the position of the entity to the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the new position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the new position.
      z - The z-coordinate of the new position.

    • incRotation

      public void incRotation(float x, float y, float z)
      Increments the rotation of the entity by the specified amounts around the x, y, and z axes.
      Parameters:
      x - The amount to increment the rotation around the x-axis.
      y - The amount to increment the rotation around the y-axis.
      z - The amount to increment the rotation around the z-axis.

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the rotation of the entity to the specified angles around the x, y, and z axes.
      Parameters:
      x - The angle of rotation around the x-axis.
      y - The angle of rotation around the y-axis.
      z - The angle of rotation around the z-axis.
